content: I have a feeling this is something that wasn't required in Drupal 7. I just tested on a fresh Backdrop site. A non-admin user with "Create post" but no permission for "view published content". I would have thought that the user would be able to add the node but not view it. But that doesn't seem to be the case.

I have a feeling this is something that wasn't required in Drupal 7...

Your feeling's misleading. The behavior is like in D7. Without the "view" permission ("access content") you can't create/edit.
Thanks @indigoxela. I had thought one would be able to create the node but get an access denied after saving. But that's fine. I'm doing a d7 upgrade so want it to behave the same

@Herb Ah, I think I know, what you had in mind: when nodes are unpublished by default, and unprivileged users don't have the permission to see unpublished content... When they save a node, they're not allowed to see it after saving.
